snippet: With Spain’s ongoing economic crisis leaving local governments in debt and businesses struggling, workers sometimes have to resort to legal measures simply to be paid.
abstract: Workers in Spain can no longer count on being paid for their labors as country struggles through fourth year of economic crisis; regional and municipal governments are deeply in debt and even government workers are finding themselves without paychecks; most workers believe they have no choice but to keep their jobs, learning to manage on occasional checks and partial payments on random dates, until economy improves.
lead_paragraph: With Spain’s ongoing economic crisis leaving local governments in debt and businesses struggling, workers sometimes have to resort to legal measures simply to be paid.

headline.seo: In Spain, Having a Job No Longer Guarantees a Paycheck
headline.main: For Spaniards, Having a Job No Longer Guarantees a Paycheck
